dt: {bc}to shove aside by pushing with or as if with the elbow

dt.t: people {wi}elbowed{/wi} each other to get a better view

dt: {bc}to force (one's way) by pushing with or as if with the elbow
{bc}to advance by pushing with the elbow

shortdef: to push with the elbow : jostle
to shove aside by pushing with or as if with the elbow
to force (one's way) by pushing with or as if with the elbow

dt: {bc}a corresponding joint in the anterior limb of a lower vertebrate
{bc}something (such as macaroni or an angular pipe fitting) resembling an elbow

et: Middle English {it}elbowe{/it}, from Old English {it}elboga{/it}, from {it}el-{/it} (akin to {it}eln{/it} ell) + Old English {it}boga{/it} bow {ma}{mat|ell|}, {mat|bow|}{/ma}
shortdef: the joint of the human arm
a corresponding joint in the anterior limb of a lower vertebrate
something (such as macaroni or an angular pipe fitting) resembling an elbow

dt: {bc}to meet and talk with (someone) in a friendly way

dt.t: The awards dinner gave me the opportunity to {it}rub elbows with{/it} some of today's greatest American poets.

shortdef: to meet and talk with (someone) in a friendly way

dt: {bc}to move along the surface of a body with pressure {bc}{sx|grate||}
{bc}to fret or chafe with or as if with friction
{bc}to continue in a situation usually with slight difficulty

dt.t: in spite of financial difficulties, he is {it}rubbing{/it} along

dt: {bc}to admit of being rubbed (as for erasure or obliteration)
{bc}to subject to or as if to the action of something moving especially back and forth with pressure and friction
{bc}to cause (a body) to move with pressure and friction along a surface
{bc}to treat in any of various ways by rubbing
{bc}to bring into reciprocal back-and-forth or rotary contact
{bc}to bring forcefully or repeatedly to one's attention

et: Middle English {it}rubben{/it}; akin to East Frisian {it}rubben{/it} to rub, scrape, Icelandic {it}rubba{/it} to scrape
shortdef: to move along the surface of a body with pressure : grate
to fret or chafe with or as if with friction
to cause discontent, irritation, or anger

dt: {bc}inflammation and pain over the outer side of the elbow usually resulting from excessive strain on and twisting of the forearm

shortdef: inflammation and pain over the outer side of the elbow usually resulting from excessive strain on and twisting of the forearm
